title: Canelo Alvarez and Gennady Golovkin 'will discuss' trilogy bout for next year
text:
Canelo Alvarez and Gennady Golovkin are set to discuss a trilogy bout next year, according to DAZN chief Joe Markowski.

The middleweight rivals were involved in two epic encounters in 2017 and 2018, with Canelo claiming a close victory in the rematch following a contentious draw.

The Mexican sensation, who has since gone on to win a world title in the super-middleweight division and unify at middleweight, is stepping up to lightweight to take on pound-for-pound great Sergey Kovalev next month.

Canelo Alvarez (left) could face arch-rival Gennady Golovkin (right) for the third time next year

Golovkin recently unified IBF and IBO middleweight titles by beating Sergiy Derevyanchenko

Golovkin, meanwhile, regained his IBO and IBF world titles by defeating Sergiy Derevyanchenko in a narrow points win earlier this month.

Both Canelo and Golovkin have long-term fight contracts with DAZN and Markowski has revealed there are plans to make a money-spinning third instalment in 2020.

'We are on record and it is clear that Canelo and Triple G have a lot of unfinished business and the fans want the third fight,' he told The Sun.

'There are huge debates about the results of those two fights, as a result, we want the third fight to happen and Canelo knows that. Making that happen is a key part of our relationship with them.

'Assuming Canelo comes through the challenge of Kovalev, which is no safe assumption because it is a hell of a test against a light-heavyweight at the top of his game, we will sit down and discuss the plan for 2020.'

Canelo defeated Golovkin last year following a contentious draw the first time around
